column30: 'Bandits are found in almost any locale
column31: for wherever there is a civilisation there will be those who prey upon the weak. There will always be higher level fighters found with large groups of bandits. Brigand: Brigands are a chaotic evil lot; otherwise they conform to the rules for bandits above. However they fight more fiercely in battle
column32: and as a result receive a +1 morale bonus.'

column29: 'Berserkers are roaming bands of fighters. They are always unarmoured
column30: as they see it as a sign of weakness. They fight with a fierce battle-lust
column31: and as a result they may strike twice in a round or make one attack at +2. They never roll for morale checks once engaged in battle.'

column24: 'Buccaneers are found on all large bodies of water
column25: their lair is most always the ship they use for raiding. pirate: Pirates are chaotic evil
column26: but otherwise conform to buccaneers above.'

column30: 'Dervishes are highly religious desert nomads. They will always be led by higher level fighters and clerics as follows. They are fanatical devotees to their religion. As a result they are at +1 to combat and never need to check morale. nomad: Nomads are mounted clans that live on steppes
column31: plains or in desert climes. They live by hunting and gathering and are closely tied to their native climate. Due to their closeness with their surroundings

column19: 'Pilgrims are groups of religious followers making their way to some holy site. They can be encountered almost anywhere.'

column27: 'Merchant encounters are actually caravans of merchants
column29: and guards. The caravan will also contain pack animals
column31: and horses. Of the number appearing rolled
column32: only about 10% will actually be merchants. 10% will be drovers and the last 80% will be the guards.'

column12: 'Save vs poison and magic at 4 levels higher'
column25: 'Dwarfs are sturdy humanoids who live in extended clans. They typically make their homes in rocky hills.'

column11: '+1 to hit with pulled bow or sword'

column19: 'Sometimes elves live in a complex civilization
column20: other times they are found living in wild bands. While there are several different types of elves
column21: most do share the following traits.\n Elves live in a rather loose society where independent clans pledge their support to a central ruler. They will likely place their homes in a secluded thicket or meadow.'

column11: '+1 to hit vs kobolds and goblins'
column12: 'Large creatures -4 to hit vs gnomes;Save vs poison and magic at 4 levels higher'
column19: 'Gnomes live underground in hills that they have burrowed into
column20: seeking gems and precious metals. They are divided into clans which are rather competitive with each other
column21: but are never outright hostile. They are a distant relative to dwarfs.'

column11: '+3 to hit with bow or sling'
column12: 'Save vs poison and magic at 4 levels higher'
column19: 'Halflings as a race value hard work and simple living. Their settlements are as likely to contain small cottages as they are to have underground dwellings. They tend to keep to themselves and ask the same of other races.'

column22: and are typically armed with spear and shield or harpoon and shield (treat their harpoons as spears). Batrachians can have shamans (maximum of 5th level) or witch doctors (maximum of 5th/4th level).'

column22: and typically do not possess weapons or armour. Anurans can have shamans (maximum of 3rd level) or witch doctors (maximum of 3rd/2nd level). They otherwise count as batrachians.'

column24: 'Tribesmen are usually found in tropical jungles
column25: or remote islands. They use large wooden shields
column26: and have the same leadership as cavemen.'

column30: 'Gnolls are large hyena-faced creatures. They are covered in a grey fur with a dark muzzle and yellow mane. They have dark eyes
column31: and long nails. Their armour is usually a mismatch of types taken from their victims. They have a rough life
column32: and their average lifespan is only 35 years. Gnolls live and travel in small bands. They sometimes form loose alliances with other gnolls. They are very adaptive and can be found in most climes. There are rumours of a gnoll overlord
column33: though if he exists his power and reach are limited.'

column26: with powerful limbs and a leonine head. Both flinds and gnolls regard flinds as more highly evolved beings and any gnoll will regard a flind as having 16 charisma. Groups of gnolls are often led by one or more flinds and the gnolls will obey any order given by a flind without question.'

column25: 'Goblins are small evil creatures with red eyes and a yellow to red coloured skin tone. They typically wear leather armour. They have an average lifespan of 50 years.'

column26: 'Grimlocks are a fierce race that dwell in the dark and hidden places of the earth
column27: periodically issuing forth to the surface in search of prey
column28: preferably human. Whilst somewhat resembling men in shape
column31: hide that is a dusky grey in colour
column32: a head of wild and matted black hair
column33: a mouthful of vicious pointed teeth and two white featureless orbs for eyes. Though it is unknown whether grimlocks speak a language
column34: it is certain that they are entirely blind as a race.'

column31: hairier goblins with brown to grey fur. They have bright red or orange faces and yellow or brown coloured eyes. They have an average lifespan of 60 years.'

column23: 'Kobolds stand 3 ft tall and have a dark skin tone (brown to black)
column24: with no hair. They are vaguely reptilian in appearance with scales
column26: short snaky tails and red eyes. They have an average lifespan of 135 years.'

column31: and are colored in many different shades of green. They have cold black eyes
column32: and hard nails on their fingers. Some have a bony ridge along their backs. Lizard men speak their own tongue
column33: and a few (10%) can also speak common.'

column26: disgusting creatures with a brown or brownish-green coloured skin tone. Their hair is a nest of black or dark brown. They wear rusty and misused armour. They have an average lifespan of 40 years.'

column30: 'Troglodytes are a tribal race of reptilians that make their lairs deep underground. They have infravision (90 ft range). They have an unnatural hatred of humans
column31: and will attack them on sight. Troglodyte skin is normally a dark green colour. However
column32: they have the ability to alter this colouration depending on the area around them (much like a chameleon). This ability allows them to surprise others on a 1-4. This surprise bonus does not work when they are emitting their odour. They have bony fins along their skulls
each with a single eye centred under its slightly drooping brow. These oafish
column33: antisocial creatures prefer to inhabit lonesome environs

column23: 'Cloud giants usually live in giant castles at high elevations. When not high up in the mountains
column24: their castles are on clouds given substance by magic. The majority (90%) of giants have average intelligence; the remainder are very intelligent and most often live in castles in the sky. Cloud giants often dress in flowing clothing and fancy jewellery. They have bronze to white hair
column25: with skin in tones of blue ranging from nearly white to cold

column24: fire giants often live in castles (50%)
column25: but are just as likely to frequent caves. Fire giants’ hair is the red and orange colour of flames
column26: and their skin is soot black. Their teeth are flame orange
column27: and their eyes red. The commonly wear armour on their broad
column28: 6 foot wide shoulders. This armour is sometimes made from the skin of dragons.'

column24: 'Frost giants get their name from their love of the cold. They often live within frosty caverns
column25: but also have a propensity to take up residence in castles
column26: as do some of their other giant kin. This love of the cold is reflected in the fact that frost giants are completely immune to ill effects from cold
column27: including the bone-chilling breath of white dragons. Frost giants have the overall appearance of giant
column28: muscled barbarians. They have light yellow or blue eyes
column29: with white hair that can likewise be tinged with yellow or blue.'

column23: 'Hill giants live in mostly inhospitable locations. Half of the time hill giants have other animals or beings guarding their homes. In many ways hill giants resemble larger ogres
column25: and they will often wield some type of bludgeoning weapon. In fact
column26: hill giants frequently (50%) also speak the language of ogres. They have skin of rust brown or tan
column27: with similarly coloured rust or black hair. They dress in animal skins.'

column23: 'Stone giants live in mountainous locations exclusively in caverns or otherwise in the earth. They are most active at night. Stone giants are partially named for their stone-like complexions and iron coloured eyes. Their hair is also dark-stone coloured
column24: sometimes with hints of blue. Whereas hill giants often use wooden clubs
column25: stone giants prefer stone and wear skins the colour of stone.'

column24: 'Storm giants are the most formidable of giants in many campaigns. Storm giants are too intelligent
column26: and magically endowed to toss rocks like their brethren. Instead
column27: storm giants can employ the following spell-like abilities once per day: lightning bolt (8d8 damage)
column33: they can levitate their own weight plus an additional weight equal to 30
column34: 000 gold pieces two times per day. Storm giants can breathe and otherwise function underwater unimpeded. They are immune to all damage by electricity
column35: including the fearsome electrical bolt breathed by the dreaded blue dragon. There are two typical appearances of storm giants
column36: related to their preference for environment. Those who choose to live under water are often of green hair
column38: while those above water have purple skin
column39: eyes either purple or cloudy grey

column22: 'Ettins are dirty creatures that wear tattered skins and often use wicked weapons
column23: such as barbed clubs. They share some affinity to orcs

column24: 'Ogres are malicious beings who live in all environments
column25: whether above or below ground. They have affinity with hill giants and trolls
column26: and often can be found with them. Additionally
column28: and will hire themselves out to other creatures toward this end.'
well versed in magic and of unnatural size and strength. They stand around nine or ten feet tall

column32: but some are said to be green or even blue. Most have reddish coloured eyes

column30: putrid creatures found in almost any climate. They can attack up to three opponents at a time using their powerful limbs to claw and their wicked teeth for biting. After three rounds of combat
column31: their innate regeneration ability will start working
column32: recovering 3 hit points per round. Their ability to regenerate even allows detached limbs to reattach to their body. Severed limbs will even continue to attack foes independently. A troll can only be truly destroyed by fire or acid
column33: and these type of damage cannot be regenerated.'
